member.name: T:WampSharp.Cra.MockWampCraProcedures
member.summary: Mocked IWampCraProcedures for use in registering with the RpcMetadataCatalog.

member.name: T:WampSharp.Cra.IWampCraProcedures
member.summary: Contract for v1 WAMP-CRA RPC Calls.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.IWampCraProcedures.AuthReq(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: RPC endpoint for clients to initiate the authentication handshake.
member.param: Authentication key, such as user name or application name.
Extra data for salting the secret. Possible key values 'salt' (required, otherwise the secret is unsalted), 'iterations' (1000 default), and/or 'keylen' (32 default).
member.returns: Authentication challenge. The client will need to create an authentication signature from this. The type WampCraChallenge can be deserialized from this.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.IWampCraProcedures.Auth(System.String)
member.summary: RPC endpoint for clients to actually authenticate after requesting authentication and computing a signature from the authentication challenge.
member.returns: A set of permissions the client is granted when authentication was successful.

member.name: T:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraHelpers
member.summary: WAMP-CRA Authentication Helper methods.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraHelpers.DeriveKey(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Computes a derived cryptographic key from a password according to PBKDF2 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PBKDF2. The function will only return a derived key if at least 'salt' is present in the 'extra' dictionary. The complete set of attributes that can be set in 'extra': salt: The salt value to be used. iterations: Number of iterations of derivation algorithm to run. keylen: Key length to derive.
member.param: The secret key from which to derive.
Extra data for salting the secret. Possible key values 'salt' (required, otherwise returns @secret), 'iterations' (1000 default), and/or 'keylen' (32 default).
member.returns: A derived key (Base64 encoded) if a salt is provided in the extra parameter, or the value of parameter 'secret' if not.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraHelpers.AuthSignature(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Compute the authentication signature from an authentication challenge and a secret.
member.param: Extra data for salting the secret. Possible key values 'salt' (required, otherwise uses @authSecret), 'iterations' (1000 default), and/or 'keylen' (32 default).

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraHelpers.PBKDF2Sha256GetBytes(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Implements PBKDF2 functionality by using a pseudorandom number generator based on HMACSHA256.
member.exception: Thrown when one or more arguments are outside the required range.
member.param: The number of pseudo-random key bytes to generate.
The password used to derive the key. After use, the password and salt should be cleared (with Array.Clear)
The key salt used to derive the key. After use, the password and salt should be cleared (with Array.Clear)
The number of iterations for the operation. The iteration count should be as high as possible without causing unreasonable delay.
member.returns: A byte array filled with pseudo-random key bytes.

member.name: T:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraAuthenticator`1
member.summary: WAMP-CRA is a cryptographically strong challenge response authentication protocol based on HMAC-SHA256. The protocol performs in-band authentication of WAMP clients to WAMP servers. WAMP-CRA does not introduce any new WAMP protocol level message types, but implements the authentication handshake via standard WAMP RPCs with well-known procedure URIs and signatures.

member.name: T:WampSharp.Cra.IWampCraAuthenticator
member.summary: Interface to data regarding a client that is authenticated (or being authenticated).

member.name: P:WampSharp.Cra.IWampCraAuthenticator.ClientSessionId
member.summary: Gets the sessionId of the connected client.

member.name: P:WampSharp.Cra.IWampCraAuthenticator.AuthKey
member.summary: The authKey provided by the client during the WAMP-CRA authentication request.

member.name: P:WampSharp.Cra.IWampCraAuthenticator.IsAuthenticated
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the user identified by AuthKey is successfully authenticated.

member.summary: Specialized constructor for use only by derived classes.

member.summary: Gets all RPC methods in this collection.
member.returns: An enumerator that allows foreach to be used to process all RPC methods in this collection.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraAuthenticator`1.GetTopicContainer
member.summary: Gets topic container.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraAuthenticator`1.AuthReq(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: RPC endpoint for clients to initiate the authentication handshake.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraAuthenticator`1.Auth(System.String)
member.summary: RPC endpoint for clients to actually authenticate after requesting authentication and computing a signature from the authentication challenge.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraAuthenticator`1.GetAuthSecret(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the secret value for the supplied auth key used to hash the challenge. Return null if the key is not found.
member.param: Authentication key, such as a user name or application name.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraAuthenticator`1.GetAuthPermissions(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Called to get the permissions the user identified by @authKey BEFORE the user is authenticated. A copy of the client's request 'extra' is provided, and you can alter it here. This will be passed back to the client as WampCraChallenge.extraAuth and MUST be what is actually used for generating the secret.
member.remarks: Here is a good place to check/fix something in @extra that is out of whack with the request, like capping the number of iterations, or specifying a different (stricter, presumably) salting mechanism. I really don't know or understand the purpose of sending available endpoints to an unauthenticated user. These are only used as part of the challenge, and are regurgitated to you in OnAuthenticated. I see no reason why you have to return anything here (yes, null is fine), and you can do all the work in OnAuthenticated(), including returning the real list of permissions.
member.param: Authentication key, such as user name or application name.

Extra data for salting the secret. Possible key values 'salt' (required, otherwise the secret is unsalted), 'iterations' (1000 default), and/or 'keylen' (32 default). You may change these here and the client must use this method of signing.
member.returns: The permissions of the user if successfully authenticated.

member.name: M:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraAuthenticator`1.OnAuthenticated(System.String,WampSharp.Cra.WampCraPermissions)
member.summary: Called after the user is successfully authenticated. This call is the last opportunity for you to set the WampPermissions, as these will be used to determine rpc and pub/sub operations for the remainder of this session.
member.remarks: NOTE: Throwing an exception here could put you in a bad state. We'll send an error to the client, and make them unauthenticated in this case.
member.param: Authentication key, such as user name or application name.
The permissions initially granted in the call to GetAuthPermissions(). You could change these, and the updated copy is what will be returned to the client from its call to auth().

member.name: P:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraAuthenticator`1.AuthKey
member.summary: The authKey provided by the client during the WAMP-CRA authentication request.

member.summary: Gets the sessionId of the connected client.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether we are waiting for an auth call after an authreq.

member.name: P:WampSharp.Cra.WampCraAuthenticator`1.AllowAnonymous
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether we allow anonymous logins. An anonymous login is one where the authKey is null or an empty string.
